question: Which of the following is a characteristic feature of the Indus Valley Civilization?
option1: Their chief deities were Mother Goddess and Shiva
option3: They had all amenities of a developed city life
option4: They did not know of iron
answer: They had all amenities of a developed city life
explanation: The significant features of Indus Valley civilization are personal cleanliness, town planning, construction of burnt-brick houses, ceramics, casting, forging of metals, manufacturing of cotton and woolen textiles. Mohenjo-Daro people had finest bath facilities, drainage system, and knowledge of personal hygiene.
